Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.open firefox
2.visit any website
3.use debugdiag(beta2) to monitor memory leak and app crash

Actual Results:  
memory leak first, app crash later.

Expected Results:  
general

The bug report is built by DebugDiag beta2(microsoft). U can download the 
report from my blog site:
http://www.cnblogs.com/Files/juqiang/firefox.rar

If u need details memory dump file, u can contact me by email:
juqiang1975@msn.com

comments.author: timeless@bemail.org
comments.raw_text:
reporter:
1. you're using ff1.0.6 which is
 a. not the latest 1.0.x release (1.0.7 is)
 b. based on mozilla1.7 which is very very old

2. firefox release builds have their symbols stripped whicih means the addresses
you list are almost entirely useless. msvcrt!strcmp+10 is probably correct, it
probably means something in firefox passed a null pointer to strcmp. bit
firefox!jpeg_mem_init+7f47 is almost certainly not the address of code inside a
function jpeg_mem_init.

3. combining crash and leak reports in the same bug is not a good idea

4. don't try filing leak reports against old branches or against builds for
which you don't have symbols.

if you have an interest in poking either of these issues, please file a new bug
about the individual issue. for the crash, a talkback incident id will suffice.
you can build firefox yourself (--enable-debugger-info-modules) to get a useful
stack trace for either problem.

2. firefox release builds have their symbols stripped whicih means the addresses

probably means something in firefox passed a null pointer to strcmp. bit
firefox!jpeg_mem_init+7f47 is almost certainly not the address of code inside a
function jpeg_mem_init.

3. combining crash and leak reports in the same bug is not a good idea

4. don't try filing leak reports against old branches or against builds for
which you don't have symbols.

if you have an interest in poking either of these issues, please file a new bug
about the individual issue. for the crash, a talkback incident id will suffice.
you can build firefox yourself (--enable-debugger-info-modules) to get a useful
stack trace for either problem.
